description: Proposed single storey rear wrap around extension and 2x skylights to existing front roof slope
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>Any new surfaces within Root Protection Areas should be installed using a no-dig method unless approved by the LPA Tree Officer in advance.</p><p>REASON: To ensure the protection of existing trees and their root systems during and after the construction process.</p>

<p>The Arboricultural Method Statement and plan submitted in support of the application shall be adhered to in full, subject to the pre-arranged tree protection monitoring and site supervision, detailed in 6.5.2 of the Tree Report, by a suitably qualified Project Arborist. A report by the Project Arborist including photos of ground protection and roots encountered during excavation shall be provided to the Tree Officer.</p><p>Reason: Required to safeguard and enhance the character and amenity of the site and locality and to avoid any irreversible damage to retained trees pursuant to section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.</p>

<p>All new materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of the visual amenities of the surrounding area and the Northwold and Cazenove Conservation Area&nbsp;</p>

<div style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">Limitations to construction and excavation within RPAs:&nbsp;<span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">No mechanical excavation shall occur within the RPA; this is because where roots&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">are encountered by excavators the roots can sustain longitudinal shattering&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">which causes extensive damage to the tree.&nbsp;</span></div><div style=""><span id="m_2418775540515769894gmail-docs-internal-guid-e8e402b2-7fff-2a96-88c1-54cd0647c7d5" style=""><br><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Excavations of the upper 750mm associated with any construction activities&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">within the RPA shall be carried out carefully and by hand tools only e.g. spades,&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">shovels, trowels etc. Care must be taken to avoid damage to the bark of parts of roots that will be retained.&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Note: it is often the case that roots are not present below 750mm depth, however if&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">roots are still encountered then hand excavations must be employed until no&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">more roots are encountered. Once below the horizon containing roots it may be&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">possible, following assessment by the arboricultural consultant, to use a&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">machine whilst under arboricultural supervision.&nbsp;</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">If significant roots (i.e. above 25mm diameter), are discovered during the&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">excavations then they must be retained. Small roots (i.e. below 25mm), may be&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">severed using clean, sharp hand tools. (Roots above 25mm in diameter may only be&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">severed following consultation with the arboricultural consultant with regard to&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">the tree’s health and stability).&nbsp;</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Where concrete is to be used within the excavations, the retained root zone must&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">be protected against toxification from the curing leachate, the face of the&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">excavations on the tree side must be lined with a non-permeable membrane&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">such as a 1200 micron polythene sheet.&nbsp;</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Where roots are to be left exposed for any period of time, they shall be wrapped&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">in clean damp hessian to prevent desiccation.&nbsp;</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to backfilling, retained roots should be unwrapped and surrounded by sharp&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">sand (not builder’s sand because of the high salt content which is toxic to tree&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">roots) or another loose granular material before soil is replaced.&nbsp;</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The fill materials shall be free of contaminants and other foreign bodies that may&nbsp;</span><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">be potentially injurious to tree roots.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="background-color: transparent;"><font face="Arial, sans-serif" size="2">REASON: To safeguard and enhance the character and amenity of the site and locality and to avoid any irreversible damage to retained trees pursuant to section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990</font></span></p></span></div><div><br></div>

<p>Before any development or construction work begins, a pre-commencement meeting shall be held on site and attended by the developers appointed arboricultural consultant, the site manager/foreman and a representative from the Local Planning Authority (LPA) to discuss details of the working procedures and agree either the precise position of the approved tree protection measures to be installed OR that all tree protection measures have been installed in accordance with the approved tree protection plan. The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details or any variation as may subsequently be agreed in writing by the LPA.&nbsp;</p><p>Reason: Required prior to the commencement of development in order that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that the trees to be retained will not be damaged during development works and to ensure that, as far as is possible, the work is carried out in accordance with the approved details pursuant to section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990</p>
